skyproc.gui

Class SUMGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • skyproc.gui.SUMGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class SUMGUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The standard GUI setup used in SUM. This can be used to create GUIs that manage your settings, handle savefiles, and hook directly into SUM.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • closeWindow

        public void closeWindow()
        Closes the GUI and starts patching if needed. (as if user hit the exit button)

      • open

        public static void open(SUM hook,
        java.lang.String[] mainArgs)
        Opens and hooks onto a program that implements the SUM interface.
        Parameters:
        hook - Program to open and hook to
        mainArgs - Pass the main String args from your main function here

        public static void setPatchNeeded(boolean on)

        Parameters:

      • exitProgram

        public static void exitProgram(boolean generatedPatch,
               boolean forceClose)
        Immediately saves settings to file, closes debug logs, and exits the program.
        NO patch is generated.
        Parameters:
        generatedPatch - True if a patch was generated before exiting.
        forceClose - Will force close if true, otherwise will dispose and naturally let the program close (which may not happen, given certain circumstances)

      • startImport

        public static void startImport(java.lang.Runnable codeToRunAfter)
        Starts importing desired mods. Runs code after it's finished.
        Parameters:
        codeToRunAfter - Runnable object with code to execute after.

      • startImport

        Starts importing desired mods.
